long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension mainly provides a context menu which allows to lookup selected text on different sites.
For translations, at the moment only english and german are supported on pages like google translate and leo.org.
Besides those, sites like urban dictionary, wikipedia and quora are available.

Additionally to looking up stuff, some supportive functions for people with way too many open tabs are available which allow to move, cut and paste ranges of tabs or reload multiple tabs at once.

Also, there's a config menu which tries to let you customize the extension to your exact needs.

Feel free to drop a line on twitter if you have requirements, suggestions or comments.

Many similar applications already exist, the main reason for creating yet another one was that most of them open the new tab at the end of the tab list and if your browser window contains more than just a handful of open tabs this can get very annoying.
It was probably easier to roll my own than to contact all the developers to change theirs.
